snippet: After a deadly meningitis outbreak, some former employees described shortcuts at a drugmaker with many of the same owners as the New England Compounding Center.
abstract: State and federal health officials ask drug manufacturer Ameridose to suspend operations so that an on-site investigation can be conducted; company has many of the same owners as the New England Compounding Center, which is at the center of a national investigation into a meningitis outbreak; former employees of Ameridose say it often takes dangerous shortcuts and has poor oversight.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and ANDREW POLLACK
byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Boston and Andrew Pollack from Los Angeles. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: After a deadly meningitis outbreak, some former employees described shortcuts at a drugmaker with many of the same owners as the New England Compounding Center.

headline.seo: Workers Cite Concerns at Firms Tied to Meningitis
headline.main: Ex-Workers at Firm Tied to Pharmacy Had Safety Fears
headline.print_headline: Ex-Workers Cite Safety Concerns At a Drug Firm
